title: (x) Visa corporate sans - Whitney {Florian}
content:
Hi there!

Does anybody know which font that is? It’s used by Visa. Is it a custom font? Who designed it?

By the way, does anybody know a good website where I can look up company fonts?

Thanks a lot,

Juergen

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080203163634im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Font_5811.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Sans serif "About us" - H&FJ Gotham {Aashim Tyagi}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080203163634/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41597 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Sans in Mini Cooper ads and brochures - Mini Headline {Jan E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080203163634/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41583 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Jui

comments.content:
Hi Jürgen,

it’s [Whitney](http://web.archive.org/web/20080203163634/http:/typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100026) by [Tobias Frere-Jones](http://web.archive.org/web/20080203163634/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Tobias%252BFrere-Jones), identified in [this older thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20080203163634/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19127).  
You can always [run a search](http://web.archive.org/web/20080203163634/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20visa) if you know what you’re looking for.

For your second question:  
There’s [a list of Corporate fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080203163634/http:/www.typografie.info/typowiki/index.php?title=Hausschrift-Liste_Unternehmen-zu-Schrift) at German Typografie.info.

An older Typophile thread mentions several [corporate initiated typeface designs](http://web.archive.org/web/20080203163634/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27315)

And there’s the [Website about Corporate Identity](http://web.archive.org/web/20080203163634/http:/users.ncrvnet.nl/mstol/index.html) by Hans Stol with a lot of useful information.  
F

Hey Florian!  
Thanks! That answers all my questions!

You’re welcome.

[Hey, you’re the Jürgen of [J&I](http://web.archive.org/web/20080203163634/http:/www.juergenundich.de/), right? Wow, a design celebrity on typophile – at least for me, I really dig a lot of the work you’ve done!]
